intro: Scyphostrychnos psittaconyx, commonly known as the yellow-stemmed sycamore, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes many plants with aromatic properties. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers that appear in clusters. It typically grows in woodland areas and is known for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its ecological role in local ecosystems.
